Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; two added white lines at centre of sherd; exterior: narrow black band on top of rim above dot and billet pattern and single brown line; below, reserved with double outlined hourglass symbol.
Curator's comments: The letters 'AΠ' are written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.456.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 301, no. 1084)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1129) (phase 2)
